alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 452 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Chugwater, or 30 miles north of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 44 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County
